name: KELT-19 A
scenarioDescription:
The KELT-19 A Exoplanetary System


Overview

KELT-19 A is a star with 1.62 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.83 times its radius. It is located 987.600368 light years away from the solar system.

KELT-19 A is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KELT-19 A system

KELT-19 A b

KELT-19 A b was discovered by the KELT observatory using the Transit method. The mass of KELT-19 A b is 1293.5681 times the mass of Earth. The radius of KELT-19 A b is 21.409 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, KELT-19 A b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, KELT-19 A b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system KELT-19 A, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by KELT.
